Package Model

Class VendingMachine

java.lang.Object
Model.VendingMachine
Direct Known Subclasses:
SpecialVM
public class VendingMachine extends Object
The Model.VendingMachine class is the class that consists of a Model.BankNotes storage and an array of items which it can sell to earn money. It can accept money in Philippine peso denominations as well as produce change in the same way as well. The machine can also restock, display transactions, and edit the prices based on the needs of the operator

    • VendingMachine

      public VendingMachine(BankNotes money)
      A constructor method that allows that initiation of an instance of the vending machine class
      Parameters:
      money - a set of denominations that determines how much money the machine has

  • Method Details

    • addItem

      public void addItem(Items item, int index, int qty)
      addItem method allows for the addition of an item slot in the machine
      Parameters:
      item - is the type of item to be added
      index - is the slot number the item will be assigned to
      qty - is the amount of items to be added

    • initializeHistory

      public void initializeHistory()
      Initializes the transactions made for each item to 0

    • restockItem

      public int restockItem(String ItemName, int addStock)
      The restockItem method allows the operator to replenish the quantity of the items being sold inside the vending machine
      Parameters:
      ItemName - is the name of the item the operator intends to replenish
      addStock - is the amount of items to be added
      Returns:
      the index of the item being restocked

    • editPrice

      public int editPrice(String ItemName, int newPrice)
      The editPrice method allows the operator to change the price of the item being sold
      Parameters:
      ItemName - is the name of the item which will be modified
      newPrice - is the new price the item can be bought at
      Returns:
      the index of the item being modified

    • addMoneytoSystem

      public void addMoneytoSystem(BankNotes money)
      addMoneytoSystem allows the addition of Model.BankNotes inside the machine
      Parameters:
      money - the denominations to be added in the machine

    • takeMoneyfromSystem

      public void takeMoneyfromSystem(BankNotes userMoney)
      takeMoneyfromSystem method allows the operator to collect money from the machine, subtracting it
      Parameters:
      userMoney - is the money to be subtracted from the machine

    • BuyItem

      public BankNotes BuyItem(BankNotes userMoney, int nSlotChoice, int nQtyChoice)
      BuyItem is the method that facilitates the purchase of an item; from the stock being depleted, receiving the money from the buyer, and returning adequate change to the buyer. It also updates the transaction history
      Parameters:
      userMoney - is the money being inserted in the machine
      nSlotChoice - is the index of the item being purchased
      nQtyChoice - is the amount of an item a user wants to purchase
      Returns:
      the excess money after the purchase

    • BuyCustom

      public BankNotes BuyCustom(BankNotes userMoney, int[] nQtyChoice)
      BuyCustom method allows the user to input multiple items and create a special product based on the combination of items that the user inputs and subtracts from their money accordingly To be Overidden in SpecialVM
      Parameters:
      userMoney - is the amount of money the user has inserted
      nQtyChoice - is the amount of each item inserted by the user
      Returns:
      the change to the user

    • buildProduct

      public String buildProduct(int[] Qty)
      buildProduct is the method that allows the user to create the product to be displayed to the user. To be overidden in SpecialVM
      Parameters:
      Qty - is the amount of each item the user inputs
      Returns:
      the name of the product the user created

    • processProduct

      public String processProduct(int[] Qty)
      processProduct builds the string process that will be showed to the user in the creation of their specified product. To be overidden in SpecialVM
      Parameters:
      Qty - is the amount of each item the user inputs
      Returns:
      the total procedure for the item
